props.name: afterCls
props.desc: A css class to apply after the effect

props.name: afterStyle
props.desc:
A style specification string, e.g. "width:100px", or an object in the form {width:"100px"}, or
a function which returns such a specification that will be applied to the Element after the effect finishes

props.name: block
props.desc: Whether the effect should block other effects from queueing while it runs

props.name: callback
props.desc: A function called when the effect is finished

props.name: concurrent
props.desc: Whether to allow subsequently-queued effects to run at the same time as the current effect, or to ensure that they run in sequence

props.name: duration
props.desc: The length of time (in seconds) that the effect should last

props.name: easing
props.desc: A valid Easing value for the effect

props.name: remove
props.desc: Whether the Element should be removed from the DOM and destroyed after the effect finishes

props.name: scope
props.desc: The scope of the effect function

props.name: stopFx
props.desc: Whether subsequent effects should be stopped and removed after the current effect finishes

props.name: useDisplay
props.desc: Whether to use the display CSS property instead of visibility when hiding Elements (only applies to effects that end with the element being visually hidden, ignored otherwise)
